intro: Aplectrum rostratum, commonly known as the tawny false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish to purple flowers. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
